MyCovertChannel module

class MyCovertChannel.MyCovertChannel[source]

Bases: CovertChannelBase

receive(log_file_name, min_ttl_val, max_ttl_value, num_ttl_ranges, sender_ip)[source]

Receives and decodes the covert message from TTL field manipulation.

  • min_ttl_val: Minimum TTL value (e.g., 32)

  • max_ttl_value: Maximum TTL value (e.g., 224)

  • num_ttl_ranges: Number of TTL ranges (e.g., 4 for 2-bit encoding)

  • sender_ip: IP address of the sender

send(log_file_name, min_ttl_val, max_ttl_value, num_ttl_ranges)[source]

Encodes and sends the covert message using TTL field manipulation.

  • min_ttl_val: Minimum TTL value (e.g., 32)

  • max_ttl_val: Maximum TTL value (e.g., 224)

  • num_ttl_ranges: Number of TTL ranges (e.g., 4 for 2-bit encoding)

stop_filter(packet)[source]

Source Code

 1from CovertChannelBase import CovertChannelBase
 2
 3# from threading import Event
 4from scapy.all import IP, UDP, sniff
 5import math
 6import random
 7import time
 8import warnings
 9
10warnings.simplefilter("ignore", SyntaxWarning)
11
12
13class MyCovertChannel(CovertChannelBase):
14    def __init__(self):
15        super().__init__()
16        self.received_message = ""
17        self.received_bits = ""
18        self.stop_event = False
19
20    def send(
21        self,
22        log_file_name,
23        min_ttl_val,
24        max_ttl_value,
25        num_ttl_ranges,
26    ):
27        """
28        Encodes and sends the covert message using TTL field manipulation.
29
30        - min_ttl_val: Minimum TTL value (e.g., 32)
31        - max_ttl_val: Maximum TTL value (e.g., 224)
32        - num_ttl_ranges: Number of TTL ranges (e.g., 4 for 2-bit encoding)
33        """
34        binary_message = self.generate_random_binary_message_with_logging(log_file_name)
35        range_size = (max_ttl_value - min_ttl_val + 1) // num_ttl_ranges
36        bits_per_packet = int(math.log2(num_ttl_ranges))
37
38        start_time = time.time()
39        for i in range(0, len(binary_message), bits_per_packet):
40            chunk = binary_message[i : i + bits_per_packet].ljust(bits_per_packet, "0")
41            value = int(chunk, 2)
42            ttl = min_ttl_val + (value * range_size) + random.randint(0, range_size - 1)
43            packet = IP(dst="receiver", ttl=ttl) / UDP(dport=12345, sport=12345)
44            super().send(packet)
45
46        end_time = time.time()
47        duration = end_time - start_time
48        capacity = len(binary_message) / duration
49        #print(f"Covert Channel Capacity: {capacity:.2f} bps")
50
51    def receive(
52        self, log_file_name, min_ttl_val, max_ttl_value, num_ttl_ranges, sender_ip
53    ):
54        """
55        Receives and decodes the covert message from TTL field manipulation.
56
57        - min_ttl_val: Minimum TTL value (e.g., 32)
58        - max_ttl_value: Maximum TTL value (e.g., 224)
59        - num_ttl_ranges: Number of TTL ranges (e.g., 4 for 2-bit encoding)
60        - sender_ip: IP address of the sender
61        """
62        range_size = (max_ttl_value - min_ttl_val + 1) // num_ttl_ranges
63        bits_per_packet = int(math.log2(num_ttl_ranges))
64
65        def process_packet(packet):
66            if IP in packet and UDP in packet and packet[IP].src == sender_ip:
67                ttl_value = packet[IP].ttl
68                if min_ttl_val <= ttl_value <= max_ttl_value:
69                    value = (ttl_value - min_ttl_val) // range_size
70                    bits = format(value, f"0{bits_per_packet}b")
71                    self.received_bits += bits
72
73                    while len(self.received_bits) >= 8:
74                        char = self.convert_eight_bits_to_character(
75                            self.received_bits[:8]
76                        )
77                        self.received_message += char
78                        self.received_bits = self.received_bits[8:]
79
80                        if char == ".":
81                            self.log_message(self.received_message, log_file_name)
82                            self.stop_event = True
83
84        sniff(
85            filter="udp and port 12345",
86            prn=lambda pkt: process_packet(pkt),
87            stop_filter=self.stop_filter,
88        )
89
90    def stop_filter(self, packet):
91        return self.stop_event
